title: [ISSUE #3929] wake up client’s waiting when server crashed
body:
This PR is aimed to  wake up client’s waiting when server crashed. 
When producer has send message to broker successfully and wait for response，but broker crashed at this time，the produer would  blocked until timeout and wouldn't retry. This PR can detect broker crashed and wake up producer's waiting state, then producer will resend message to other broker.

title: fix a flaky test
body:
**Make sure set the target branch to `develop`**


**Description**
The test `org.apache.rocketmq.common.filter.FilterAPITest.testBuildTagSome` may fail 
since `getTagsSet()` returns a `HashSet` that has undetermined iteration order. One can check for that using the [NonDex](https://github.com/TestingResearchIllinois/NonDex).

**Reproduce the failure**
```
mvn install -pl common -am -DskipTests
mvn edu.illinois:nondex-maven-plugin:1.1.2:nondex -pl common -Dtest=org.apache.rocketmq.common.filter.FilterAPITest#testBuildTagSome
```

**Solution**
Use `containsExactlyInAnyOrder()` instead of `containsExactly()` for the failing AssertJ assertion.

title: [ISSUE #3953] Fix: Change Retry-Queue Num Will Cause Retry-Message Loss
body:
This PR is aimed to fix a bug which may cause retry-message loss.

When we change the num of retry-queue to 2 while the default is 1 by the command : ./mqadmin updateSubGroup -c xxx -g xxx -q 2 -n xxx.
Then we found that the retried messages were exactly half consumed. If we fetch the retry-topic route at this time , the thing will be found that the retry-queue count is still 1.

title: [#3942]If both acl and message trace are enabled and the default topic RMQ_SYS_TRACE_TOPIC is used for message trace, you don't need to add the PUB permission of RMQ_SYS_TRACE_TOPIC topic to the acl config.
body:
**Make sure set the target branch to `develop`**

## What is the purpose of the change

If both acl and message trace are enabled and the default topic RMQ_SYS_TRACE_TOPIC is used for message trace, you don't need to add the PUB permission of RMQ_SYS_TRACE_TOPIC topic to the acl config.

### Case1: Only `conf/plain_acl.yml` exists:

➜  distribution git:(issue-3922) ✗ tree conf 
```sh
conf
├── 2m-2s-async
│   ├── broker-a-s.properties
│   ├── broker-a.properties
│   ├── broker-b-s.properties
│   └── broker-b.properties
├── 2m-2s-sync
│   ├── broker-a-s.properties

│   └── broker-b.properties
├── 2m-noslave
│   ├── broker-a.properties
│   ├── broker-b.properties
│   └── broker-trace.properties
├── acl
├── broker.conf
├── dledger
│   ├── broker-n0.conf
│   ├── broker-n1.conf
│   └── broker-n2.conf

├── logback_namesrv.xml
├── logback_tools.xml
├── plain_acl.yml
└── tools.yml
```

```
  groupPerms        : [groupA=DENY, groupB=PUB|SUB, groupC=SUB]
```

title: [ISSUE #23] solve error Algorithm HmacSHA1 not available when your java_home is not found
body:
add find_java_home function to avoid error: Algorithm HmacSHA1 not available


**Make sure set the target branch to `develop`**

## What is the purpose of the change

Solve error Algorithm HmacSHA1 not available when your java_home is not found by adding find_java_home function to tools.sh

## Brief changelog

Solve error Algorithm HmacSHA1 not available when your java_home is not found by adding find_java_home function to tools.sh

## Verifying this change
eg: 172.17.0.2 is you rmqnamesrv ip address

you can use this command(`docker exec -it rmqbroker ./mqadmin clusterList -n 172.17.0.2:9876`) to  verify if RocketMQ broker works now.

#23 Deploy broker with docker-compose returns NoSuchAlgorithmException

title: Re-enable testing on ARM64
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

Some time ago I have enabled testing on Linux ARM64 with https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/commit/98aca7ffcbf282b2885ad4b9c433927a5ac0e78b
I see that it has been disabled with https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/commit/360b616b6fc2e137f30340c87314b4c65a1750b2 because the builds were unstable (timing out).

With this PR I suggest to re-enable it but this time using AWS Graviton2 nodes at TravisCI because they are more stable than Equinix Metal ones (`arch: arm64`) and run it on Ubuntu 20.04 instead of 18.04.

## Brief changelog

Re-enable testing on Linux ARM64 at TravisCI

## Verifying this change

TravisCI build should pass!
